Articles.Content:
So I just watched a KerbalEssences video (It was really good btw if you're reading this), and I'm wondering, what's that thing at 41 seconds? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BcQi0CTV5Xo

 

EDIT: Thanks Moderators:)

Edited January 22, 2016 by Spaceception

An obscure shape with an edited human face.  It appears to hold the rotary valve still while the other visible one (and presumably the rest) spin into place.

Fairly certain it's a reference to that old Twilight Zone Episode (my memory is a bit hazy, so forgive if I get a few details wrong) where a man sees a gremlin on the wing of the commercial airliner that he's flying in.  Nobody believes him (instead being sure that he is crazy), but after the plane lands, it is revealed that a few wing panels were missing, appearing to have been ripped off, ergo implying that he wasn't crazy, and that the gremlin was actively trying to bring down the plane, while hiding from everyone except that one guy.  I think Family Guy (and likely a few other shows) have done parodies of this story.

So: a gremlin caused the crash!  For realizies! 

 

Edit: I don't see gremlin as a vote option... will vote it if it appears

Edited January 22, 2016 by Slam_Jones
*Twilight ZONE, you mean, right...? "Twilight" was a series of movies about a teenage girl and a vampire-like object.

45 minutes ago, parameciumkid said:

*Twilight ZONE, you mean, right...? "Twilight" was a series of movies about a teenage girl and a vampire-like object.

Which is sad, since the word twilight, which is a pretty cool word, is now associated with a series that's not very good. I like the Twilight Zone, it's one of my favorite shows of all time. 

But, I think it's sonethinf. It's certainly sonethinf.

2 hours ago, Slam_Jones said:

An obscure shape with an edited human face.  It appears to hold the rotary valve still while the other visible one (and presumably the rest) spin into place.

Fairly certain it's a reference to that old Twilight Episode (my memory is a bit hazy, so forgive if I get a few details wrong) where a man sees a gremlin on the wing of the commercial airliner that he's flying in.  Nobody believes him (instead being sure that he is crazy), but after the plane lands, it is revealed that a few wing panels were missing, appearing to have been ripped off, ergo implying that he wasn't crazy, and that the gremlin was actively trying to bring down the plane, while hiding from everyone except that one guy.  I think Family Guy (and likely a few other shows) have done parodies of this story.

So: a gremlin caused the crash!  For realizies! 

 

Edit: I don't see gremlin as a vote option... will vote it if it appears

Added

3 hours ago, parameciumkid said:

*Twilight ZONE, you mean, right...? "Twilight" was a series of movies about a teenage girl and a vampire-like object.

Good catch, didn't realize I missed a word... yes indeed, Twilight ZONE, as in the old sci-fi TV series about unrelated fictional events, and NOT the human/wolf/vampire love story movies.

Edited January 22, 2016 by Slam_Jones
